oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Isaac Shelby to John Sevier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Isaac Shelby to John Sevier asking for corroborative testimony as to Shelby's services in the Battle of King's Mountain, South Carolina. Letter written on August 12, 1812.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Revolutions; Battlefields; Evidence (Law)
United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783; Sevier, John, 1745-1815; King's Mountain, Battle Of, S.C., 1780;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Shelby and Sevier led American settler-patriots against the British in the Battle of King's Mountain [South Carolina], October 7, 1780. The patriots routed the British in a little more than an hour. The battle turned the tide of the war in the South.
